title: we need to address the real issues with support
body:
no, IP boosts, RP boosts, XP, LP gains whatever, is not going to make support a desirable role. Artificial interest will only make more problems. 

Stop dancing around the issues; if you want supports to be played more, then you need to address the role itself. They're under-leveled, under-item'd, and quite frankly I think their gameplay patterns are terrible. They're not fun to play but a lot of them have been god damn infuriating to play against at their prime. Utility supports are reliant on AP, a stat they don't get enough gold to buy and can't get enough of unless they manage to stack a Mejai's or save up for items beyond their budget. Tank supports are only tanky if their pockets are lined with assist gold. Some mages have such broken base damage  that a handful of them can succeed without a gold income, and now they're starting to populate the bottom lane.

Direct changes need to be made. Supports need to change to feel better to play and more fair to play against; utility supports should not require AP, or at least not as extremely as they do right now; mage supports should not have the raw numbers they do. Outside of the tanks, supports need more items that DON'T give them CDR. Locket and Redemption really shouldn't be as absolutely necessary as they are. XP distribution needs to change, and not just for supports' sake; we could take this chance to allow melee fighters and other carries to lane bot without relying on a bullshit snowball first-tower meta, and solve support leveling in the same swoop. 

what do you guys think

There are many problems with the support role.

1. (This is probably the biggest one) It is an incredibly _thankless_ task. Supports are like beleaguered housewives who are working four jobs to support their shitty children and one slip-up means all of them die.

2. Support champions are _boring_. Most supports are the most uninteractive characters in the game. Although the recent support reworks and releases have  been much more fun and impactful, the traditional support is thought of as "heal this, ward that:, "tank this, cc them", etc. If you're lucky you'll secure a kill or win a teamfight.

3. Support itemization is F'd up the A. Bruisers like Fiora, Camille, and Irelia all share one item: Trinity Force. Mages all share Morellonomicon, etc. Supports? Good luck finding a unified core to work from. All supports have become jacks of all trades, masters of none. You can build literally anything on anybody and it could work because nobody knows what the hell is going on anymore.

4. Do you want to know why people don't like to autofill into supp? Because you _die_. **A lot**. And you can do nothing about it. That's why mages like Vel'Koz and Zyra have become so popular. They help their team and can hold their own if pressed.

It has become boring, i feel as i'm not the one trying to cs, supports can watch the game as a whole, watch their team win solo trades early or lose them, then saying "well our top is the only one fed so i guess my best shot is to cover their ass and hope they can carry us."

I feel that his passive soul scaling was a great idea to add to his lantern and flay, but could have been the key to a support who, if he keeps getting souls, thats what would make him strong in a game, not having to cover the adc for their weaknesses and losing out on gold.

If a jungler ganks early, how likely is he to get a kill or 2? suddenly your role as support goes from maybe i can hurt the laners and help trade to, oh shit don't die. unless your a full on mage "supporting" you have no chance of punishing, let alone killing, an enemy jungler who knows what they are doing. your role in the game becomes team cheer leader or ff@20 because you suddenly have next to no ipact inthe game without dying in the process. 

The support role does suck currently, it will almost certainly suck unless something is overtuned, or your a brand nuking the enemy botlane while ez is farming up his tear. i think that is how someone gets bored and decides to bring someone like ziggs bot, he is a fun champ who does a great deal of dmg via poke, suddnely he is the apc and now adc's are being replaced. this is hilarious to watch btw as supprts still suck. plz let adc's become cs farm bots as a role. have the mage carries replace the suppors entirely. that will spice up this meta.

we had this problem with Annie 2 years ago, it was fixed by:

Nerfing her bases and buffing her scalings
Making her utility level dependent (stun gains duration at level breakpoints).

Annie is still viable at support, but she's no longer oppressive. You can do the same thing for Brand, Malz, Velkoz and Zyra.

As a support main, my main gripe with the champion pool is that most support champions have a very straight forward kit. There really are not many high mobility, high outplay potential, consistently mechanically demanding  characters in the support roster. 

I have a very specific view on what support role is currently lacking. As I've expressed it at great length this past week in other threads I refer you to go look for my opinion there. The TL;DR is that the XP and items issue is a red herring that distracts from the real problems, and that solving the real issues will result in solo lanes and junglers losing out on fun. 

For this thread, I would like to ask you a question. You, specifically, do not play support on this account. Why? 
Why do you prefer your lane over support?
What are the things you enjoy most about your role? 
What are the things that, if you could do them as a support, would make you play support?
Is there a power fantasy that you think is lacking in the support role? What kind of power fantasies should exist in the support role? Which of those are denied now? What kind of power fantasy, even if it is in your mind not suited for the support role, if it exists for supports would make people who are currently playing mid, jungle and top desire the role?

>You, specifically, do not play support on this account. Why?

i do play support though, i have 260k on bard and mastery 7 for him and taric, and i have janna as a pocket pick.

i'm not playing support in season 7 if i can help it, because i would rather not play a role where im guaranteed to build the same 4-5 items each game. not to mention mage supports are too strong for both of my mains to handle in lane; no thanks. 

>What kind of power fantasies should exist in the support role? 

strong debuffs, less hard CC, less shield/heal shit. just a good, old fashioned buff support.

What do I think? For starters, that i'm tired of people telling me how not fun a role is that I have a genuine blast playing. And while it's not the majority, there is a faithful number that agree with me. 

The rest of the theory crafting bores me at this point since nothing new is getting said and all ideas have been brought up. To be frank, I don't care if supporting is ever popular. It will always draw in a specific crowd, just like every other role. Some of us just simply like working in the background to get our team to victory. 

The real issue is the playerbase's need for glory, and that's an inherent flaw of humanity. Good luck finding a fix to that.

I disagree with supports not beeing fun to play or haveing terrible gameplay patterns. I like playing most support champs, just not the position.
The main issues are gold/xp gain and inventory. You have one itemslot for sightstone, one for controll wards, and most likely redemtion and locket and sometimes the active gp/10, so even if you had the gold, you have not much space to use it. And frankly, the one thing that used to be supports big strength isn't that great anymore: warding. Back in the daysm supports might have been ward bots, but they had the tools to wage the visionwar all on their own for the whole team, aslong as the team protects the support from getting picked off in the procces.
Now i hardly feel like i can sustain even a baseline of vision, and even for that i have to frequently back to refill sightstone.

Nothing can be fixed up to perfection, the post is implying to improve the role of supports through means of XP and itemization. Atleast make supports feel like they are doing something and are part of the team.

I agree with not having utility scale with AP. Though I think that would remove most scaling power from supports. 

Granted I don't actually know.

My issue is that people think support is unpopulated because you aren't a carry when, in actuality, it's unpopulated because support play patterns and itemization is more boring than watching paint dry in most instances. If someone tries to point this out? "No, support is FINE. This role is so fun!" Few days later? "Why is no one picking support I'm tired of being auto-filled!!!!!". It's crazy how wild this community is in its own naivety sometimes.

I don't like increasing gold income i think the current pool has plenty of gold to buy items its just items like sightstone, locket and redemption are so absolutely mandatory that it gates you from real choices.

Xp gain is a serious issue if that problem is solved then i think it'll be in an ok spot.

Honestly, I'm not even sure it would matter.

Many people just don't like playing supportive roles in video games, preferring to be the damage-oriented "carry".

They can try to improve the support role, but many people are just predisposed against supporting in general.

most supports in league are fairly low-interaction or low counterplay 

it's not really a surprise if they're unpopular overall given how few of them can make big plays beyond a clutch heal or shield, as opposed to the aoe mage supports landing a 5 man ult and shredding people by themselves.
